titleStmt.title: Letter from George Colman to the Manager of Covent Garden, 10 October 1825.

sponsor.orgName: Mary Russell Mitford Society: Digital Mitford Project

editionStmt.edition: First digital edition in TEI, date: 2 August 2013. P5.

notesStmt.note: Any special notes on this text? (optional)
You can have multiple notes here.

msDesc.head: Letter from George Colman to The Manager, Theatre Royal, Covent Garden 10 October, 1825.

support.p: PaperOne octavo sheet folded twice. No address leaf.

supportDesc.condition: Letter complete on the front of the sheet only.

editorialDecl.p: The letter writer's spelling and punctuation are retained, except where a word is split at the end of a line and the beginning of the next in the manuscript. Where the spelling and hyphenation of words deviates from the standard, in order to facilitate searching we are using the TEI elements “choice,” “sic,” and “reg” to encode both Mitford’s spelling and the regular international standard of Oxford English spelling, following the first listed spelling in the Oxford English Dictionary. The long s and ligatured forms are not encoded.

div.p: I have been this day,In forwarding, this day to your messenger, a License for "Lilla" to your messenger honourd with instructions to transmit the Play entitled "Charles the First" to the Lord Chamberlain, who is now in Scotland, & who will, from after a perusal of the Manuscript, form His own judgment upon the propriety of licensing the representation of a Drama so peculiar in it's title, & incidents.
Whatever, therefore, may be the finalultimate decision, the License for acting the abovementioned Piece is, pro temporeat all events, suspended.
div.closer:
I have the honour to be,
Sir, your
obedient humble Servant
G. ColmanThe Manager,Theatre Royal,Covent Garden.
